result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant BRANDON J REILLY in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for the public defender but would like a court appointed attorney. def states he contacted two attorneys already. Def states he can pay $50 a month, first payment to be due June 1, 2022. Court will review the form. Court instructs def to fill out the form and submit to the COC office.

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for BRANDON J REILLY
Current: 215 Foster St, Oshkosh, WI 54902 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2022)
Prior: 3085 10th Ave, Grand Marsh, WI 53936
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

9:23 AM Defendant BRANDON J REILLY in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis in court for BRANDON J REILLY. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is not eligible for the public defender. Court will set for Status of Counsel for May 10, 2022 at 10:00 AM. If def retains an attorney before that hearing, a notice of retainer needs to be filed or the defendant needs to show up for court.

Court adjourned at 9:25 PM.
